result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert B Tanner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with same probation conditions as stated in 14CF43.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are granted for work, AODA, and treatment/counsleing pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. . Report today to jail to get start date or transfer if eligible. To serve within 60 days and may transfer to Outagamie county.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Robert B Tanner in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Atty Sheets appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  
Case: 14CF43: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation:   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. No Contact with Kohls or Walmart in Plover.    Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time. Pay costs.  Pay restitution of $619.97 may be joint/several.
Case: 14CF51 Count 2: W/H Sentence: 12 mo Probation: Conditions: 90 days jail. Comply with same conditons of 14CF43.  Pay costs.  Count 1 to be DRI.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
No contest 14CF43 and 14CF51 ct 2.
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF43 and 14CF51 Ct 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 14CF51 Ct 1 is dismissed read in.

ADA Cousins sentencing statements.
Atty Sheets sentencing statements and requests no jail time or 30 days jail on 14CF51 to serve within 60 days and transfer to Outagamie county.
Defendant makes apologetic statements to the Court.

BTC:************PROBATION**********

14CF43: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation:   
Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
No Contact with Kohls or Walmart in Portage County.    
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time. 
Pay costs.  
Pay restitution of $619.97 joint/several with co-defendant.

14CF51 Count 2:   W/H Sentence: 12 mo Probation: 
Conditions: 90 days jail. With Huber for work, AODA, and treatment. Report today to jail to get start date or transfer if eligible. To serve within 60 days and may transfer to Outagamie county.
Comply with same conditons of 14CF43.  
Pay costs.
Plea hearing on August 27, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert B Tanner in court with attorney Eric P. Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Bond in this file is covered by 14CF43.

Defendant Robert B Tanner in court with attorney Eric P. Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews the files. 
Atty Sheets indicates defendant was in custody in Marathon County. 
BY THE COURT:  Warrants are vacated.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

14CF51:
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

  Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Cousins requests a signature bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Defendant does not appear. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF43 and 14CF51

Atty Sheets indicates defendant may be in custody in another county. 
Atty Cousins requests a warrant. 
Court reviews the complaints. 
BY THE COURT: 
Court finds complaints show probable cause. 
Criminal warrants with $500 cash alternative on each file for a total of $1,000.
